meanings.definition: Lacking light or illumination; dim; obscure.
meanings.sent1: The room was so darks that I could barely see my hand in front of me.
meanings.sent2: The night sky was darks, with only a few stars twinkling above.
meanings.sent3: When the power went out, the house was plunged into darks, and we had to use flashlights.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as darks as the storm clouds gathering on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The forest at night was a realm of darks shadows and mysterious sounds.

meanings.sent1: I was afraid of the darks as a child and always slept with a night light.
meanings.sent2: The cave was filled with darks, and I could hear bats fluttering overhead.
meanings.sent3: The darks seemed to swallow up everything in the room, making it feel eerie.
meanings.sent4: In the darks of the night, the city took on a different, mysterious vibe.
meanings.sent5: The deep darks of the ocean held secrets yet to be discovered by humans.

meanings.sent1: She painted her room in darks tones to create a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The artist used darks and lights to create a striking contrast in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The darks of the forest floor were broken by patches of sunlight filtering through the leaves.
meanings.sent4: His favorite color was a deep darks that reminded him of the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds gathered in darks swirls, promising heavy rain.
